What Is One Person Company?

OPC is a Private Limited Company which is governed by Companies Act 2013, under which a single person with a nominee is required

is required to incorporate it.

One Person Company came into existence after the implementation of the Companies Act, 2013.

Unlike earlier, now it is possible for there to be only 1 member in the company,

and that member could also be the director of the company.

One Person Company provides benefits of a sole proprietorship and has the features of a company.

Any resident or non-resident Indian can register an OPC in India.

Registration Process of OPC:

  • Apply for Digital Signature Certificate (DSC)

  • Apply for Director Identification number (DIN)

  • Name approval application

  • Submission of required documents

  • Filing of forms with MCA (SPICE+)

  • Filing of Nominee Consent (INC-3)

  • Issue of the Certificate of Incorporation

  • Issue of PAN & TAN

    • Documents Required For Incorporation OPC

  • Director : Indian national

    • < PAN Card of Director

  • Address proof (Passport, Electricity bill, Telephone bill, Ration card, Driving license, Voter id card, Aadhaar card)

  • Residential proof (Bank statement, Electricity bill, Telephone bill, Mobile bill)

  • Director : Foreign national

    • < Passport

  • Address proof (Driving license, Residence card, any form of identity issued by the government with the address mentioned)

  • Residential proof (Bank statement, Electricity bill, Telephone bill, Mobile bill)

  • Registered office proof of the company

  • Memorandum of Association (MOA)

  • Articles of Association (AOA)

  • Nominee Consent Form

  • NOC Signed

  • Copy of property papers (if the property is owned)
